item.title: Are Your T1 Lines Saturated?
item.description:
By: John Shepler The perfect network connection is invisible. Whether it uses copper wires, coaxial cable, fiber optics, or wireless technology, if it impacts your network traffic, it’s not truly transparent. The more noticeable these limitations become, the more they hinder productivity, demanding your attention. Artificial Limitations Shared broadband services like Cable, DSL, 4G Cellular, or satellite internet, despite promising “best effort,” are inherently limited by technology and company policies. Each type has a maximum capacity, typically accessible round-the-clock, except for rare outages...

item.title: How Fiber Optic Metro Ethernet Works
item.description:
By: John Shepler Are you spending too much on connecting your different business locations? Do you desire scalable bandwidth with reliable, dedicated speed, minimal lag, and uninterrupted data flow? Let’s explore how fiber optic Metro Ethernet connections can benefit your business: Having a single provider manage both the core network and the connections to each location offers significant cost savings. item.title: Benefits of a Gigabit Ethernet Network Connection
item.description:
The demand for high-capacity internet connections has caught some businesses off guard. What started as a T1 line evolved into a DS3 connection and maybe even an OC3 fiber optic service, but there always seems to be a bottleneck. It might be time to upgrade to Gigabit Ethernet (GigE). It’s important to understand that those older telecom services you’ve been using are based on telephone technology. While they’re dependable, they weren’t designed for today’s network needs...
